page.title: 03 Life in Chartham Hatch
page.content: We met the wives of two Parish Councillors, they lived in mellow bungalows merging with the woods. The older lady and her husband had designed and built their own bungalow ten years previously.The other younger lady had also lived there for ten years.We learnt the following information from these people: There were enough retired folk in the village to fill 3 cars when they visited the over-sixties club in Chartham. More younger people appeared to be moving into the village. There was only one bus service a day, the bus leaving for Canterbury at 10.30am and returning at 1.30pm. Clearly some form of motorised transport was essential if you lived here.
